conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: walls extruded with thickness, multiple faces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall corners and interior volume; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification of some corner/trim geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches (dining top-left, kitchen top, living right, bedroom left, bath core, stair zone bottom-right). Some mismatches in the entrance/stair-side enclosure and a few partition/door placements appear shifted or simplified versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and placed plausibly: bed in bedroom, dining set in dining, sofa/armchair/table in living, basic kitchen counters, toilet and sink. Wash-area details are simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of walls/floors/openings with good lighting; no obvious mesh breaks. Presentation is clean and uncluttered.

detected_errors.description: Entrance/stair-side geometry and some internal partition extents do not perfectly align with the 2D plan (likely simplified or slightly repositioned).
Some doors/windows appear different in exact wall location/orientation compared to the 2D plan, though openings are generally present.
Bathroom/wash-area fixture set is simplified relative to the 2D plan's wash area + toilet separation.

summary: A clear, valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric construction and a largely faithful layout, but with minor-to-moderate deviations in some partitions and opening placements.
